verses.text: Then the daughters of Zelophehad, son of Hepher, son of Gilead, son of Machir, son of Manasseh, of the families of Manasseh the son of Joseph, came near. The names of his daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.comment: Keeps wording and genealogy order as in Hebrew. Other translations sometimes present the genealogy less literally.

verses.text: They stood before Moses, and before Eleazar the priest, and before the leaders and all the people at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, saying,
"Our father died in the wilderness, and he was not among the company of those who gathered together against the Lord—in the company of Korah—but he died in his own sin, and he had no sons.
verses.comment: “In his own sin” means “for personal guilt,” as in Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: Why should our father’s name be removed from his clan because he had no son? Give us a possession among our father’s brothers."
Moses brought their case before the Lord.
verses.comment: Simple and literal, as in Hebrew.

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
"The daughters of Zelophehad are right. You shall surely give them a possession of inheritance among their father's brothers, and transfer their father's inheritance to them.
verses.comment: Reflects the legal language in the Hebrew.

verses.text: And you shall speak to the people of Israel, saying, 'If a man dies and has no son, then you shall give his inheritance to his daughter.
And if he has no daughter, then you shall give his inheritance to his brothers.
And if he has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his father's brothers.

And if his father had no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his nearest kinsman in his clan, and he shall possess it. This shall be a statute and ordinance for the people of Israel, as the Lord commanded Moses.'"
verses.comment: The phrase 'nearest kinsman' follows Hebrew terminology ('goel').

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, "Go up into this mountain of Abarim and see the land I have given to the people of Israel.
verses.comment: Abarim is preserved as the Hebrew place name.

verses.text: When you have seen it, you also shall be gathered to your people, as Aaron your brother was gathered,
verses.comment: “Gathered to your people” means 'joined your ancestors in death.'

verses.text: because you rebelled against my command in the wilderness of Zin when the congregation quarreled, failing to sanctify me at the waters before their eyes. (These are the waters of Meribah of Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.)
Moses spoke to the Lord, saying,
"Let the Lord, the God of the spirits of all flesh, appoint a man over the congregation,
verses.comment: "God of the spirits of all flesh" as in Hebrew phrasing.

verses.text: who shall go out before them and come in before them, who shall lead them out and bring them in, that the congregation of the Lord may not be as sheep that have no shepherd."
verses.comment: Keeps the shepherd imagery present in Hebrew.

verses.text: So the Lord said to Moses, "Take Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is the spirit, and lay your hand on him.
verses.comment: "Man in whom is the spirit" is literal from Hebrew (referring to God's Spirit).

verses.text: Make him stand before Eleazar the priest and all the congregation, and you shall commission him in their sight.
verses.comment: "Commission him" reflects the legal conferral of authority.

verses.text: You shall give some of your authority to him, so that all the congregation of the people of Israel may obey.

And he shall stand before Eleazar the priest, who shall inquire for him by the judgment of the Urim before the Lord. At his word they shall go out, and at his word they shall come in, both he and all the people of Israel with him, the whole congregation."
verses.comment: Urim is left untranslated, as in most literal renderings.

verses.text: And Moses did as the Lord commanded him. He took Joshua and made him stand before Eleazar the priest and the whole congregation.
And he laid his hands on him and commissioned him, as the Lord had spoken through Moses.
verses.comment: Literal representation of Hebrew commissioning ritual.
